purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.app_details: A self-service app for employees to browse and request devices.

app_screens.screen_details: Allows users to browse available devices, view specs, photos, and availability, and filter by department-approved models.
Form for selecting a device, justifying business need, selecting urgency level, and auto-populating employee details from Azure AD.

features.feat_0010: Responsive Design for Multiple Device Types
features.feat_0012: Error Handling and User Feedback Mechanisms

mvp_components.flow_details: Workflow to manage the approval process of device requests.

flow_actions.action_details: Manager receives a notification for a new device request to approve or reject.
Manager can approve or reject the request with comments within a 2 business day SLA.

actions.action_0001: Send an approval email to the manager
actions.action_0002: Condition: If approved, continue to next step; if rejected, end the flow with a rejection message

connectors.Approval: Start and wait for an approval

mvp_components.trigger: When a new item is created in SharePoint list

post_mvp_modules.details: Add a screen to the app for employees to view the status of their requests and receive email notifications at each step.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Integrate with Power Automate to trigger status updates and email notifications. Consider a Power BI dashboard for more detailed tracking analytics.

post_mvp_modules.details: Create a model-driven app for IT Administrators to update stock levels and mark orders as fulfilled. Integrate with procurement systems like SAP.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Model-driven apps are well-suited for complex scenarios with multiple entities and can easily integrate with external systems like SAP.

integration_points: Azure Active Directory for user details
Procurement system (e.g., SAP) for inventory management
notes: Post-MVP features should be prioritized based on the evolving needs of the organization and the feedback from the MVP phase.
